intro: Psiadia quartziticola, commonly known as the quartziticola daisy, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often growing on quartzite rock formations. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hair, which helps reduce water loss. Psiadia quartziticola is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in harsh environmental conditions.
